allAccordionItems.title: What is RuneFX?
allAccordionItems.content: RuneFX is a copmany dedicated to bla bla bla... Ok, for real though this is my graduation project and this whole shbang is fake. A big website that looks real, and it worked because I graduated no problemo.

allAccordionItems.title: How can I get my artwork featured on the webpage?
allAccordionItems.content: So, al of the art on the webpage were nice artworks I found on arstation. I own none of the rights and they all belong to their original authors. Back to the fake-company formal speak.

allAccordionItems.title: Which operating systems does RuneFX support?
allAccordionItems.content: RuneFX is available for Windows 10/11, and Linux (Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and newer).

allAccordionItems.title: Do you offer educational licenses?
allAccordionItems.content: Yes, we offer special educational pricing for academic institutions. If you are an individual student you may use the Non commercial liscence freely (Assuming you aren't doing any commercial work).

allAccordionItems.title: What are the system requirements for Runic Renderer?
allAccordionItems.content: Minimum: 64-bit CPU, 16GB RAM, 5GB storage, OpenGL 4.0 compatible GPU with 4GB VRAM. Recommended: 8+ core CPU, 32GB RAM, 10GB SSD storage, NVIDIA RTX/AMD equivalent GPU with 8GB+ VRAM. For optimal performance on complex projects, we recommend higher specifications.

allAccordionItems.title: Can I transfer my license between computers?
allAccordionItems.content: Yes, standard licenses can be activated on up to 2 devices simultaneously for the same user. You can deactivate on one machine to free up an activation slot. Studio licenses include more flexible deployment options based on your specific agreement.

allAccordionItems.title: How do I report bugs or request features?
allAccordionItems.content: You can report bugs through our forum under the Issues section of the appropiate topic.
